question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: NativeTableContext::new()] [Resolver lifetime] Is the resolver lifetime ('a) properly validated to ensure it outlives all table operations, or can use-after-free occur if the resolver is dropped prematurely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: NativeTableContext::new()] [txn_hash manipulation] Can different validators receive different txn_hash values for the same transaction, causing them to generate different TableHandles and diverge on state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: NativeTableContext] [Extension context injection] Can an attacker inject a malicious NativeTableContext into the extensions, bypassing security checks or corrupting table operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Endianness issues] Does the to_be_bytes() call for table_len ensure consistent byte ordering across all platforms, or can endianness differences cause handle generation divergence? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: NativeTableContext::into_change_set()] [Function value extension mismatch] If different validators use different FunctionValueExtension implementations, can this cause serialization differences and state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: NativeTableContext] [Tid trait exploitation] Can the Tid trait implementation be exploited to cause type confusion when retrieving the extension from NativeContext? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: Table::content] [BTreeMap memory exhaustion] Can an attacker add entries to cause the BTreeMap to consume excessive memory, leading to out-of-memory crashes or performance degradation on validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Stack overflow] Can deeply nested or large values cause stack overflow during serialization, deserialization, or value manipulation operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: serialize()] [Max depth bypass] Does max_value_nest_depth properly limit recursion depth, or can an attacker craft values that bypass this check to cause stack overflow? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: TableData::tables] [TriompheArc reference counting] Can reference counting issues with TriompheArc<MoveTypeLayout> cause use-after-free or memory leaks if the Arc is dropped unexpectedly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: into_change_set()] [Bytes clone overhead] Does the clone operation for Bytes in the change set cause excessive memory copies for large table values, enabling memory exhaustion attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [SHA3-256 implementation] Is the Sha3_256 implementation from the sha3 crate cryptographically secure and resistant to collision attacks, or can hash collisions be exploited? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Hash input order] Does the order of digest.update() calls (txn_hash then table_len) matter for security, or can reordering attacks manipulate handle generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Digest finalization] Is the digest.finalize() operation guaranteed to clear sensitive state, preventing hash state leakage across multiple handle generations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [AccountAddress::from_bytes error] The error handling for from_bytes - can malformed hash output ever cause this to fail, and if so, does error handling prevent handle generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Permission bypass] Can an attacker call table modification functions without proper authorization, bypassing Move-level access control and modifying other users' tables? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_table_handle()] [Handle extraction exploit] Can an attacker extract table handles from StructRef and use them to access tables they shouldn't have access to? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Unauthorized read] Can an attacker borrow values from tables they don't own by crafting or guessing valid table handles and keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Unauthorized deletion] Can an attacker remove entries from other users' tables by providing the correct handle and key without owning the table? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: table_natives()] [Address validation] Is the table_addr parameter properly validated to ensure table natives are only registered at authorized addresses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: Table::get_or_create_global_value()] [NumBytes overflow] When converting val_bytes.len() to u64 for NumBytes, can extremely large values cause overflow or truncation issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Gas calculation overflow] When adding base + per_byte_serialized * num_bytes + load_cost, can integer overflow occur causing gas to wrap around to small values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Table counter overflow] After creating many tables, can table_len overflow when incremented, causing the counter to wrap to 0 and generate duplicate handles? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: CommonGasParameters::calculate_load_cost()] [InternalGas addition overflow] Can the gas parameter additions cause overflow in the InternalGas type, leading to incorrect gas calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Assertion violation DoS] The assertions for ty_args.len() and args.is_empty() - can an attacker violate these to crash validators by calling natives with wrong argument counts? (Medium)
